Etikio sneakers are available in hi top and low top, in white, blue and red. Sizes 5 to 13 (US sizing, or 4 to 12 UK/AU sizing) – we’ll contact you to confirm. 
Etiko is rated GREAT by Good On You.
Conscious Step Sock Collection
Usually $46, now just $41 

Includes three pairs of certified organic and Fairtrade socks that support three important causes: HIV therapy to pregnant women in Africa, planting trees in Kenya and meals to children in need.
Three eye-catching styles, delivered in a recycled paper gift box. Get these socks with soul today!
Conscious Step is rated GREAT by Good On You.
Hurry before this offer and campaign ENDS SOON!

Fashion Without Harm
The free Good On You app empowers you to make shopping choices that match your values.

The app rates fashion brands for their impact on people, the planet, and animals.
The app was launched in Australia and New Zealand last year and has tens of thousands of users. It rates more than 1,000 clothing, footwear and accessory brands and helps you discover brands that are doing better on the issues you care about.
Join us to bring the Good On You app to North America!
Back us now! Shop one of the great brands on our perks. (Scroll down for images of the perks!)
Click here to ask a question, make a comment, or sign up to be notified when the app is launched,


Do You Know The Real Cost of The Clothes We Wear?
Do we know the stories hidden behind the labels?
Too often the clothes we buy come at an unacceptable price for the world’s poorest people, our environment, and animals.
We Have The Power to Create Change!
What if you could see exactly how brands treat their workers, the environment, and animals?
What if you could know that  every time you shop you are doing what you can to avoid association with sweatshops, child labor, environmental harm or animal exploitation?


 
The Good On You App Puts The Power In Your Hands



Find out how your favorite brands rate on the issues you care about. The Good On You app includes ethical brand ratings for more than 1,000 brands. With your support, we’ll add many more US and Canadian brands!

Discover hundreds of brands that are doing more to reduce poverty, and protect the planet and animals. When you search a mainstream brand you'll see brands with similar brands that rate higher! 

Find great deals on ethical brands.  We offer discounts to make it easier for you to choose the brands that are right for you and for the world.

Use your voice and send a message to brands, urging them to do better or congratulating them on their efforts.



 

 So What's Wrong with Fashion?

 
 

 


Let's Bring Good On You to North America
We want to bring the Good On You app to North America to empower millions of people to make a difference every time they shop.
Good On You is already making a difference with tens of thousands of people already using the app in Australia and New Zealand. 
$15,000 will fund the work needed to bring the app to North America in February 2017. This will cover tech updates and ratings for brands available in the US and Canada. Around 200 of those will be smaller and mid-sized ethical brands that consciously and actively address working conditions, environmental impacts, and animal issues.
If we can reach $30,000  we will be able to rate even more brands. We'll also get to work on extending Good On You to include ratings for beauty and personal care brands – this is the most commonly requested addition from our existing users.
What are the risks?
They're pretty low. The Good On You app already exists. It's popular and works well in Australia and New Zealand. We've got a proven ethical brand rating methodology and a system for applying it. We're raising the money we need to pay our developer to tweak the app to suit North America but mostly we're raising money so we can rate more brands including the most popular and most ethical brands in the USA and Canada.
We need your help to bring Good On You to North America. Choose one of our perks to back the campaign !
 

Back the Campaign Now to Score These Great Perks
We've put together a bunch of great perks to reward everyone who supports our campaign, including some awesome ethical brands from Australia and the USA.
All product based perks come at the recommended retail price or better PLUS you get to help bring Good On You to North America empowering millions of people to make a difference when they shop! 
$5 = Join the MovementJoin the movement to change the way we shop to create a better world. We'll keep you updated  and let you know when the free Good On You App is available in your country.(AU$6.60)
$10 = Nominate a brand to be rated or store to be listedNominate a fashion brand to be rated and listed in the app for our launch in February 2017. Your chosen brand will jump the queue of hundreds of brands to be rated!(AU$13.20)
$25 = Good On You Ethical Fashion eBookThe eco, ethical, and sustainable guide to fashion. From the biggest issues in fashion, which materials to avoid and brand ratings for 10 of the most popular brands in North America.(AU$33)
$35 = Good On You Fairtrade Tote A Fairtrade, organic jute tote with exclusive screen print by Australian ethical label Mirador. Perfect for Sunday farmer's markets or a trip to the beach.(AU$46)
$46 = Conscious Step Sock Collection (3 pairs + gift box)Fight poverty while shopping ethically! These Conscious Step Socks raise awareness around the issue of poverty while striving to create a global community with their impact partner Global Citizen. Made in Fairtrade conditions with GOTS certified organic cotton. Conscious Step is rated GREAT in the Good On You app. 

$50 = $50 Voucher — Study NYShop the Study NY collection: ethical contemporary womenswear made in New York City and beyond.  Collections are cut and sewn in NYC’s garment district using both ethical fabrics and production methods. Study NY is a US brand rated GOOD by Good On You. (AU$66)
$50 = Men’s Eco Basics Pack – Boody This pack includes Boody's best-selling basics for men: Boxers, Crew-neck and Business socks. Made from organically grown bamboo yarn, these versatile and wonderfully soft items will fit seamlessly into your everyday wardrobe. Available in different colours and sizes. ($AU66)

$55 = Women’s Eco Basics Pack – Boody This pack includes Boody's best-selling basics for women: Classic bikini brief, Cami top and V-neck T-shirt. Made from organically grown bamboo yarn, these versatile and wonderfully soft items will fit seamlessly into your everyday wardrobe. Available in different colours (black, white, nude) and sizes. Boody is rated GOOD by Good On You. ($AU73)

$80 = Fairtrade Sneakers — EtikoThese sneakers for girls or guys are 100% vegan. They're made from sustainable latex rubber and certified organic and Fairtrade cotton. The dyes are PCP and AZO free. Etiko is a Fair Trade and organic Australian brand rated GREAT by Good On You. Sizes from Men's 5 to 13 (US sizing) (4 to 12 UK/AU sizing). (AU$112)Available in white, blue or red. 

$95 = Silk Shirt — The FableThese silk shirts are designed in Australia and made in Jaipur, India, by a small family-run business where workers are paid almost twice the minimum wage. The silk is 100% biodegradable and hand-dyed using vegetable dyes. The Fable is rated GOOD by Good On You. (AU$125)Available in Black, Marine Life, Egyptian Sands, Man on the Moon, Arctic Silver and Rose Quartz. 
Click here to ask a question, make a comment, or sign up to be notified when the app is launched,
 

What People Are Saying

Featured in

 

The Good On You Story
Good On You was created in 2015 by a team of Australians who wanted to make it easier for everyday people to make more ethical choices when they shop.Our vision is a world where consumers’ choices drive businesses to be sustainable and fair, to ensure that they can do everything in their power to avoid harm to people, the planet, and animals.We have backgrounds in consumer advocacy, campaigning organization, startups, business, journalism and tech. 

Help Spread the Word
We want to see a world where consumers' choices drive businesses to be sustainable and fair. Where it’s easy for you and everyone else, anywhere to choose products that support their deeply held values.
Together we can make a huge difference to the 75 million people who work in the clothing supply chain, to the environmental challenges facing our planet and to the animals who suffer needlessly.
Can you help get the word out? 
We'd love it if you could contribute to the campaign but if that's not possible - or you already have - here are some more ways to help:
1. Sign up to be notified when the app is launched in February 2017
2. Share the campaign on on Facebook, Instagram or any other social media - use hashtag  #GoodOnYou
3. Tell you friends about the Good On You campaign, in the real world or by email
4. Check out the Good Edit, our ethical fashion blog to discover new ethical brands and guides on how to shop more sustainably 
5. Support the brands and organizations that are supporting us
6. Or get in touch for more ideas about how you can get involved
 

Frequently Asked Questions
 
Who’s on the Good On You team?
Gordon Renouf, co-founder, is an experienced consumer advocate who was head of Campaigns at CHOICE, Australia’s leading consumer organization, and a Board member of Consumers International.
Sandra Capponi, co-founder, is a seasoned business professional with expertise is Corporate Social Responsibility, supply chains, branding, and strategy.
Bethany Noble, Head of Marketing, is an experienced marketer and communications specialist.
Will Farrier, Product Manager, is a journalist turned product manager by day and sings in an Indie band by night.
Celine Massa, Head of Ratings, is an experienced NGO campaigner and environmental scientist.
Ali Misradeghi, Head of Technology, is  qualified data engineer and experienced tech project manager.

 
How does Good On You rate brands?
In short, we aggregate all the public information available from certification schemes (Fair Trade, Global Organic Textile Standard and many more), from NGO investigations (Greenpeace Detox, Behind the Barcode and more) and brands own statements.
Ethical shoppers demand transparency and we’re here to reward brands that are meeting the consumer demand.
For the full story check how we rate.
How many brands will Good On You include when it launches in North America?
The app will include ratings for 1,000 mainstream brands and 250 ethical, sustainable and eco brands.
Our ultimate aim is to rate any brand that you can find! The more we raise the closer we will get to hitting that target!
We’ll use the money to make our rating system more efficient and increase the number of people working to create the ratings, helping you discover more ethical brands.
Why don’t you rate products in other categories like cosmetics, homewares or food?
We’d love to. That’s our ultimate goal. But we have to start somewhere!
 

 
How does Good On You make a difference?
We know there are millions of people who want to ‘shop their values’. But it’s really hard to do that, especially in fashion. So as we make it easy, and millions of people start to prefer transparent brands that are doing better, the companies behind the brands that are not doing well will begin to feel it in the hip pocket. They’ll be forced to change.
We don’t expect or even need you to make the best ethical choice every time you shop - that’s just not realistic. But we do believe we can empower millions of people to make better choices to build a movement to create change.
How can I get involved?
Spread the word - That’s the most important thing right now! Please share our campaign on social media or better still tell your friends directly in person!
Volunteer - If you think you have something to offer as a researcher, writer or marketer, please let us know. 
Get your ethical brand listed - If you represent a brand that is trying to make a difference, get in touch with your details. We may already have you on the list of brands to be included but we'd love to hear from you. 
Is Good On You a non-profit?
Good On You is a social business founded and partly owned by the non profit organisation Ethical Consumers Australia, a registered Australian charity.
 
What next?
Thanks for reading! 
Now's the time to back the campaign by donating or choosing one of our great perks!
Or click here to ask a question, make a comment, or sign up to be notified when the app is launched,
 
Join us to help make fashion sustainable and fair!
Sandra, Bethany, Gordon, Will, Celine, Ali, Dave, Kendall and all at Good On You

story:
Thank you!
RYB Denim is proudly moving forward into a new phase and could never have done this without all the support from you! Order forms and information are still going out and coming back in on a daily basis. Thanks for your patience.

There will be some amazing new developments and changes come 2014. Refined business direction, new work studio space, new perspective, new appreciation, and new inspiration. Spring season will see the first RYB Denim pairs out in your hands and on the road, can't wait!

RYBD will also be saying a very heartfelt and grateful goodbye to co-founder Steve Sal Debus, as he will be starting off his new year in Vancouver, BC. The last 6 months have been a fantastic experience, one in which I've learned so very much. A critical member to the launch of this endeavor, I can only wish him all the best out West!

Wishing everyone else a Happy Holiday time. Hopefully you're riding where and when you can this winter, safely and with smiles!
Best,
Chandel


RYB Denim

"Ride Your Bike" Denim

Whether you ride daily for work, out with friends, as sport or any other reason in between and beyond, wouldn't it be nice to know that your jeans feel great, look great, and will last?

RYB Denim is focused on creating jeans for women that flatter your shape, breathe and stretch as you ride, and look great on and off your bike.

A dream that is inspired by the growing number of women riding every where, every day, we need your help to make this a reality.

Your contributions will help us provide female cyclist's around the world with a pair of jeans that will enhance the enjoyment and freedom they feel while riding their bike!

Why Are We Making These Jeans?

*Most jeans wear through in the seat and saddle area, usually very quickly after you start riding in them.

*The standard center seam placement in the seat makes them uncomfortable to sit on.

*The back rise is generally too low and can expose you lower back..and even your butt..not good!

*There is not enough room designed for the movement of your thigh and calf muscles, and your knees.

*They lack other features that are benefits as you ride, like deeper pockets, a lock holder, a key holder, pocket placement, and reflective seam piping.


RYB Denim Solutions

The RYB Denim jean design came about after talking to friends and fellow cyclists from around the world.

*The RYB jean has a one-of-a-kind, unique, double-reinforced seat gusset specifically designed to eliminate saddle wear.

*The seat gusset design also removes that uncomfortable center seam

*A swooping waistband to increase coverage and comfort, higher in the back and comfortable in the front.

*Adjusted pocket size placement on the back, and deeper front pockets with comfortable openings

*Technical and custom engineering of a premium denim to make a soft, durable, stretch denim that also wicks away moisture.

*Overall, the jean is designed to fit better in all the important areas while you’re cycling with extra benefits, like a built-in lock holder, reinforced belt loops, and reflective seam piping



***NOTE the seat gusset above is shown as production colors, we will be using matching colored stitching to ensure it is discreet and still functional


Where Does the Money Go?

The $25,000 goal will allow RYB Denim to produce our first run of the classic style we are offering. The funding will go to purchasing our custom crafted denim, manufacturing costs, and distribution of this premium quality jean.

Any funds above and beyond our goal will allow us to take this project and turn it into a real company focused on producing quality garments for women who ride bikes. We'll be able to offer more styles, more colors, and in more places!


How Are We Able to Make These Jeans?

The RYB Denim team has the experience of over 20 years in the garment industry and the skills to make great jeans. Combining forces and utilizing our strengths, we can confidently say our jeans are the best and only product on the market for women that allow you to ride in comfort, are durable, and fashionable jeans.

The Fabric Mill: Our custom denim mill is Cone Denim. Cone Denim has been a leading supplier of denim fabrics to top denim apparel brands since 1891. Out of North Carolina, USA, Cone Denim worked with our fabric specialist to produce a unique and technical weave for RYB Denim.

The Fabric Specialist: Steven Sal Debus has been a technical fabric developer and garment maker for over 15 years and has traveled the world investigating the best content mixes for sportswear and streetwear. Understanding what technical aspects the jeans need to hold up to, Steven worked with Cone Denim to create the perfect blend of cotton, wicking polyester, and elastic [stretch] for the RYB Denim.

Designer: Founder and head designer, Chandel Bodner, graduated with a degree in both Fashion Design and Fashion Marketing in 2006. Her industry experience, technical ability, and personal connection to cycling give her the elements to create a product that is useful, culture-conscious, and promotes a healthy lifestyle.

Product Development: Going from design ideas and drawings to the tangible product takes time, effort, and knowledge. Teaming up with Pigeons & Thread, a local group of garment engineers who have worked on everything from costume design to development programs for large jean brands, we were able to go from design to pattern and sample sizes with ease! As cyclists themselves, they brought a lot of creative fixes and personal knowledge to the project. It's important to us that we work with our community, are a part of the environment, and collaborate with our riding companions as much as possible.

Keep It Local: We chose to make our denim in the USA and to manufacture in Canada. Both, our fabric mill and manufacturer, have long histories of making premium denim goods. Having them close by means we can ensure that our quality and high standards are maintained throughout the production process.

Risks and Challenges: While we have put together a team of the top designers, fabric makers, fit engineers, fabric mills and manufacturers there are still challenges we will face. We welcome these hurdles and have been inspired by the stories that we have heard from women around the world. Fit is a huge challenge for a jean that is meant for cycling movement, comfort and style. So as part of our project we have been fit testing samples with cyclists of all shapes and sizes for the past few months and have come up with a sizing and a fit that our team agrees is great for cycling and style.


How Do They Fit?

Watch the video below to see how you should properly measure yourself to get the best fit for you in the RYB Denim jean. Ask a friend to help to make sure it's accurate!


We understand that not all women's bodies are shaped the same, and as a cyclist there can be physical attributes that are even more difficult to fit into typical jeans. RYB Denim jeans account for room in the waist, hip, thighs, knees, and calves. The size chart below corresponds to all of these measurements. It is important to look at the waist and hip measurements first, to match your size correctly.

The sizes listed below are the only sizes we are able to offer for this production run. If you would like to discuss a size not listed, please email us and we can talk about it! 


We are also offering two different lengths on the order form, regular and long. Regular length is 31"-33" and long is 34"-36".

You don't have to decide on your exact size right away! Make a supportive contribution at any time, sizing will need to be decided at the end of the campaign deadline, that is when you will receive your order form. Plenty of time to ask questions you might have. Please contact us and we'd be happy to help you understand the fit and sizing best for you!

Perks!!!

Here are some images of the perks you get for contributing! Thank you for your support and we hope that you enjoy your new pair of jeans, tee, saddle, and smile!

RYB Logo Tank Top

RYB Logo T-shirt

The RYB Brooks Saddle



NEW PERKS!!!!

Collaboration with YNOT Cycle, Toronto based bicycle accessories manufacturer. Limited edition Saddlebags, Pedal-straps, and their most popular, Bandicoot Bag! Made with RYB Denim custom milled fabric!!! Thank you for believing in our campaign YNOT! www.ynotcycle.com

Full Range



RYB Denim Pedal Straps

RYB Denim "Bandicoot" Bag

RYB Denim Saddle Roll


Frequently Asked Questions

Are they comfortable?
The biggest question that women everywhere are going to ask is, “Are they comfortable?”.

The answer is: Yes, they are absolutely comfortable and they move and stretch as you do. "When I get on and off my bike I don’t have to readjust my jeans, they cup and they sit on your hips when you’re actually riding. Once I felt what it was like to ride with the seamless seat gusset I didn’t want to go back to my other pants and shorts. " -Emily Heffring, Team rider and tester

Does the fabric stretch?
Our custom-made 11.5 oz. denim has 2% spandex and moisture wicking polyester filaments that, when combined, add stretch to the denim. This adds comfort and contributes to personalized fit over time. Yes, these jeans will fit you better every time you wear them!

What is a seat gusset?
The unique seat gusset design, patent pending, is RYB Denim's answer to some of the health problems and discomfort that is caused by traditional center seam placement. The position of the gusset means that we've removed those bulky seams that hurt your "lady bits"!
We also double layer the fabric in the wear areas so the RYB Denim jeans are durable and last.

Why is RYB fabric better than typical denim?
The average pair of jeans is made from denim that is mostly or all cotton fibers. Although cotton is comfortable and natural, it absorbs water and tends to loosen up over time without any memory fit [stretch back]. Cotton also wears through in high friction areas faster than technical sportswear fabrics. We have created a blended 11.5 oz denim to solve these concerns. The 34% polyester filament component to our denim provides security in it's strength, and with the moisture wicking treatment applied, the rider is sure to stay dry and comfortable.

What if they don't fit?
Make sure you've watched the video above on fit and sizing, and ask any questions you might have before selecting a size for yourself.

These will not feel the same as any other pair of jeans. Do not compare them with any other jeans you have owned. They are specifically designed to be different to fit you on your bike better than anything you could currently own.

Get on your bike and ride.

If you feel these do not fit you we can exchange them for a different size. No problem.

What if I buy them as a gift and I can't take the giftee's measurements?
No problem. Put a note in the comments section that it is a gift. We will send a gift card to the receiver and ask for their measurements.

I don't understand crowd-funding, what does it mean?
Crowd-funded projects, like ours, are supported and become viable only with the contributions of it's funders. Funders view various start up companies, artists, entrepreneurs, charities, drives, etc and decide which ones they want to support and see become a real company or project. This is putting the power back in the hands [and wallets] of consumers and individuals all over the world! What better way to decide what is worth supporting and help be a part of making that happen! Our campaign offers perks in the way of our product and other enticing tangible items. We offer a range so that more individuals will consider supporting this at any amount or for any item listed.

What if RYB Denim doesn't meet it's funding goal?
We have chosen a "fixed funding" goal, this means that if we do not reach our goal amount we will refund all of the contributors their support and this product will not be produced and the company will not move forward with enough to sustain it's growth potential. This is also why no order forms are sent to contributors until the end of the campaign, November 17, 2013.

Why did we choose "fixed funding"?
The apparel industry works in the chain of supplies timeline and production capabilities. RYB Denim has consulted Cone Denim to produce our specific, custom blend denim, but like many businesses, they will only provide to us in a minimum amount. Because of this, and the production costs, packaging, and shipping to come after material is ordered, we cannot provide these at any less than our funding goal.

What is a Stretch Goal?
We will introduce various stretch goals to our campaign. These means that the original goal of $25,000, while amazing to reach, will really only let us produce this one style, in this one color, and do just the orders placed [thank you for these so far!]. But what happens next? We'd like the potential of our company to be supported by you out there as well! The more we can raise, the more we can do in the future. By introducing stretch goals we can give more options for you, and we can do more with RYB Denim in the future!

Are these jeans available in stores?
Unfortunately, not yet! Part of our business plan is to offer these in stores around the world, but we can't do that if we don't reach our funding goal here. We do offer the Shop Owner/Boutique package so that retailers may support RYB Denim and provide their local customers with this new product in the cycling market! Share RYB Denim with your local shop or boutique store if you want to see these in various sizes in your city!

What if I can't afford a pair of RYB cycling jeans? Think of it as a long term investment in a pair of jeans that will work better than what you've had in the past. If you still can't put the money together then you can use the Indiegogo tools to become a campaigner for this project and support by sharing with your friends and family!

Ways you can support and share:
"like" us on our Facebook Page: www.facebook.com/RYBDenim
tweet about our product launch! .@rybdenim #rybdenim
follow us on instagram! @rybdenim
youtube! ryb denim youtube channel

If you want to know more about Indiegogo please visit the "learn" tab at the top of the page.

THANK YOU TO ALL THOSE SUPPORTING, HELPING US GET RYB DENIM OUT OF CONCEPT AND OUT ON THE ROAD!

Please send any and all questions and comments to: info@rybdenim.com

How Do They Fit?

Watch the video below to see how you should properly measure yourself to get the best fit for you in the RYB Denim jean. Ask a friend to help to make sure it's accurate! 

We understand that not all women's bodies are shaped the same, and as a cyclist there can be physical attributes that are even more difficult to fit into typical jeans. RYB Denim jeans account for room in the waist, hip, thighs, knees, and calves. The size chart below corresponds to all of these measurements. It is important to look at the waist and hip measurements first, to match your size correctly. 
The sizes listed below are the only sizes we are able to offer for this production run. If you would like to discuss a size not listed, please email us and we can talk about it! 

We are also offering two different lengths on the order form, regular and long. Regular length is 31"-33" and long is 34"-36".You don't have to decide on your exact size right away! Make a supportive contribution at any time, sizing will need to be decided at the end of the campaign deadline, that is when you will receive your order form. Plenty of time to ask questions you might have. Please contact us and we'd be happy to help you understand the fit and sizing best for you! Perks!!!
Here are some images of the perks you get for contributing! Thank you for your support and we hope that you enjoy your new pair of jeans, tee, saddle, and smile! 
RYB Logo Tank Top

RYB Logo T-shirt
The RYB Brooks SaddleNEW PERKS!!!!
Collaboration with YNOT Cycle, Toronto based bicycle accessories manufacturer. Limited edition Saddlebags, Pedal-straps, and their most popular, Bandicoot Bag! Made with RYB Denim custom milled fabric!!! Thank you for believing in our campaign YNOT! www.ynotcycle.comFull Range
RYB Denim Pedal Straps
RYB Denim "Bandicoot" Bag

RYB Denim Saddle Roll



Frequently Asked Questions


Are they comfortable?The biggest question that women everywhere are going to ask is, “Are they comfortable?”.The answer is: Yes, they are absolutely comfortable and they move and stretch as you do. "When I get on and off my bike I don’t have to readjust my jeans, they cup and they sit on your hips when you’re actually riding. Once I felt what it was like to ride with the seamless seat gusset I didn’t want to go back to my other pants and shorts. " -Emily Heffring, Team rider and tester
Does the fabric stretch?Our custom-made 11.5 oz. denim has 2% spandex and moisture wicking polyester filaments that, when combined, add stretch to the denim. This adds comfort and contributes to personalized fit over time. Yes, these jeans will fit you better every time you wear them!What is a seat gusset? The unique seat gusset design, patent pending, is RYB Denim's answer to some of the health problems and discomfort that is caused by traditional center seam placement. The position of the gusset means that we've removed those bulky seams that hurt your "lady bits"! We also double layer the fabric in the wear areas so the RYB Denim jeans are durable and last. Why is RYB fabric better than typical denim?The average pair of jeans is made from denim that is mostly or all cotton fibers. Although cotton is comfortable and natural, it absorbs water and tends to loosen up over time without any memory fit [stretch back]. Cotton also wears through in high friction areas faster than technical sportswear fabrics. We have created a blended 11.5 oz denim to solve these concerns. The 34% polyester filament component to our denim provides security in it's strength, and with the moisture wicking treatment applied, the rider is sure to stay dry and comfortable.What if they don't fit?Make sure you've watched the video above on fit and sizing, and ask any questions you might have before selecting a size for yourself.These will not feel the same as any other pair of jeans. Do not compare them with any other jeans you have owned. They are specifically designed to be different to fit you on your bike better than anything you could currently own.
Get on your bike and ride. 
If you feel these do not fit you we can exchange them for a different size. No problem.What if I buy them as a gift and I can't take the giftee's measurements?No problem. Put a note in the comments section that it is a gift. We will send a gift card to the receiver and ask for their measurements. I don't understand crowd-funding, what does it mean?Crowd-funded projects, like ours, are supported and become viable only with the contributions of it's funders. Funders view various start up companies, artists, entrepreneurs, charities, drives, etc and decide which ones they want to support and see become a real company or project. This is putting the power back in the hands [and wallets] of consumers and individuals all over the world! What better way to decide what is worth supporting and help be a part of making that happen! Our campaign offers perks in the way of our product and other enticing tangible items. We offer a range so that more individuals will consider supporting this at any amount or for any item listed.What if RYB Denim doesn't meet it's funding goal?We have chosen a "fixed funding" goal, this means that if we do not reach our goal amount we will refund all of the contributors their support and this product will not be produced and the company will not move forward with enough to sustain it's growth potential. This is also why no order forms are sent to contributors until the end of the campaign, November 17, 2013.Why did we choose "fixed funding"?The apparel industry works in the chain of supplies timeline and production capabilities. RYB Denim has consulted Cone Denim to produce our specific, custom blend denim, but like many businesses, they will only provide to us in a minimum amount. Because of this, and the production costs, packaging, and shipping to come after material is ordered, we cannot provide these at any less than our funding goal.What is a Stretch Goal?We will introduce various stretch goals to our campaign. These means that the original goal of $25,000, while amazing to reach, will really only let us produce this one style, in this one color, and do just the orders placed [thank you for these so far!]. But what happens next? We'd like the potential of our company to be supported by you out there as well! The more we can raise, the more we can do in the future. By introducing stretch goals we can give more options for you, and we can do more with RYB Denim in the future! Are these jeans available in stores?Unfortunately, not yet! Part of our business plan is to offer these in stores around the world, but we can't do that if we don't reach our funding goal here. We do offer the Shop Owner/Boutique package so that retailers may support RYB Denim and provide their local customers with this new product in the cycling market! Share RYB Denim with your local shop or boutique store if you want to see these in various sizes in your city! 


What if I can't afford a pair of RYB cycling jeans? Think of it as a long term investment in a pair of jeans that will work better than what you've had in the past. If you still can't put the money together then you can use the Indiegogo tools to become a campaigner for this project and support by sharing with your friends and family! 

Ways you can support and share:"like" us on our Facebook Page: www.facebook.com/RYBDenimtweet about our product launch! .@rybdenim #rybdenimfollow us on instagram! @rybdenimyoutube! ryb denim youtube channelIf you want to know more about Indiegogo please visit the "learn" tab at the top of the page. THANK YOU TO ALL THOSE SUPPORTING, HELPING US GET RYB DENIM OUT OF CONCEPT AND OUT ON THE ROAD! Please send any and all questions and comments to: info@rybdenim.com

story:
Available now at cartesianscarf.com       The Cartesian® Scarf, created & patented by an architect, is designed to follow the contours of the neck & shoulders and frame the face.

It's featured in FORM Fashion: Making Math Wearable

http://www.formmag.net/monitor/tag/cartesian-scarf…

Unlike traditional flat scarves that can be too long and bulky, the Cartesian® hugs the neck.  It's perfect with a blazer or sweater.  Create your own style.  Wrap it, or wear it open.

The scarf is made from custom 100% extra fine Italian merino wool developed specifically for Cartesian® with no other materials added.  THERE ARE NO WIRES AND THE SCARF IS SUPER SOFT, NOT STIFF OR SCRATCHY.

SOLD DIRECT - FREE U.S.  SHIPPING

$78 SPECIAL INTRODUCTORY PRICE

WE'VE CREATED SOMETHING TOTALLY NEW.

THE CARTESIAN® SCARF IS ...

1.  ORIGINAL:  Invented (and PATENTED) by architect A.Trelease, the Cartesian® is SUPER SOFT and made with the highest levels of comfort & quality.

2.  DESIGNED TO LAST:  The Cartesian® is hand-finished and made entirely of 100% imported Italian extra fine Merino wool (yes, the good stuff) developed especially for the Cartesian®.  Over 100 yards of our custom yarn are used to knit one scarf, with no other materials added.

THERE ARE NO WIRES AND THE SCARF IS PLIABLE & SOFT, NOT STIFF OR SCRATCHY.  The scarf's tensile ability is a unique part of the knitting design.

3.  INNOVATIVE:  Its 3D design allows you to create lots of incredible styles.

4.  HYPER-FLEXIBLE:  A scarf you can twist, wrap, flip and bend.

5.  NIFTY:  It doubles as an exquisite head-wrap.

6.  FUNCTIONAL:  Unlike conventional flat scarves that are long and bulky, the Cartesian® is designed also to be worn under a blazer or sweater.  It maintains warmth without restricting movement or creating bulk.

The Cartesian® is a new scarf designed to conform to the contours of the neck and shoulders and frame the face.  It can assume and hold many sculptural shapes limited only to the imagination of the wearer.  It even works as a head wrap.

The Cartesian® is a whole new concept in luxury neckwear. Invented (and patented) by architect A.Trelease, the design of the scarf is equal parts form and function, and has several unusual properties based on its unique patented structure.

And it’s made with custom 100% imported Italian extra-fine Merino wool developed especially for Cartesian®.  It's super soft & feels great against the skin.

THE CHALLENGE

Traditional flat knit scarves can be bulky and bunch up or fall away from the neck.  We were hoping to develop an accessory that would hold its shape and could be worn on anyone, anywhere, dressed up or down.

For architect Anne Trelease, 50% of the appeal of design is function.  She wanted to develop something flexible to wear at meetings, or to the market, dressed up or down, open or wrapped.  In addition, the new scarf had to be elegant AND functional.

HOW DOES IT WORK?

In order for a scarf to conform to the curves of the neck and shoulders, it had to be 3-Dimensional, instead of a conventional flat shape.  After much experimentation, we discovered that creating a differential in knit tension between opposing sides along the length of the scarf produced this effect.

The differential in knit tension creates a permanent built-in curvature throughout the entire scarf that allows the scarf to maintain its shape using different wrapping methods. 

Over 100 prototypes were made.  We experimented with stitches, tension, yarn types, weights, colors and overall proportions of the scarf.  The weight of the yarn and the stitch tension greatly affected the sculptural ability/qualities of the scarf body, as well as its overall appearance.

Our extensive experimentation yielded a product that is unique, beautiful and very comfortable.

The reaction to the Cartesian® Original Scarf is overwhelming.  People of all ages ask us where they can get one.

REQUEST

The money raised from Indiegogo will be used to purchase inventory for our first production run.  This is our first business venture and we need your support to help get us started.   We're asking that you please consider the new Cartesian® Scarf.

For our initial run, we have limited quantities available in our signature architectural colors Classic Red and Charcoal Grey.   We intend to ramp up production slowly, without sacrificing quality control (each scarf is hand-finished).

Thank you so much for your support!


Have fun, stay warm . . .

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Unterstützer finanzieren Ideen, die ihnen gefallen und von Personen, denen sie vertrauen. Hier sind einige Punkte, die du in diesem Abschnitt beachten solltest:

  • Stelle dich und deinen Hintergrund vor.
  • Beschreibe deine Kampagne kurz und knackig und erkläre, weshalb sie so wichtig für dich ist.
  • Beschreibe, wobei die Unterstützer dir helfen werden.

Denke daran, dich kurz zu halten. Stelle dir folgende Fragen: Wenn jemand hier aufhört zu lesen, wäre derjenige dann bereit, Geld zu geben?

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Gehe etwas mehr ins Detail für alle Besucher, die daran interessiert sind:

  • Erkläre, wie viel Geld du benötigst und wofür es eingesetzt wird. Bleib transparent und sag konkret, worum es geht - die Leute sollen dir und deiner Kampagne vertrauen.
  • Erzähle den Leuten von deinen einzigartigen Perks. Mach sie neugierig!
  • Erkläre, wohin die Finanzmittel gehen, wenn du das Funding-Ziel nicht erreichst.

Die Folgen

Verrate mehr über deine Kampagne und lass die Leute wissen, was sie mit ihrem Beitrag bewirken:

  • Erkläre, warum dein Projekt für den Unterstützer und die Welt wichtig ist.
  • Erwähne ähnliche Projekte, mit denen du in der Vergangenheit erfolgreich warst (falls es welche gibt).
  • Mach das Projekt für die Leute real und baue Vertrauen auf.

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Die Leute schätzen deine Transparenz. Bleib offen und stich aus der Masse heraus, indem du ohne Umschweife von den Risiken und Hindernissen erzählst, die dir auf dem Weg zum Erreichen deines Ziels begegnen.

  • Informiere deine Unterstützer, warum gerade du diese Hürden überwinden wirst.
  • Beschreibe, wie du diese Herausforderungen bewältigen möchtest.

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Manche können einfach keinen Beitrag leisten, das heißt aber nicht, dass sie nicht helfen können:

  • Bitte darum, dass man über deine Kampagne spricht und sie so bekannt macht.
  • Erinnere daran, das Tool von Indiegogo dafür zu nutzen!

Das war es auch schon.

story:
Warning: the watches presented here are not an “homage” to the Submariner nor the latest specimen of Timepiece Minimalista from “affordable luxury” valley. Use caution! ;)

Atelier Wen Porcelain Odyssey

Ji（霁）

Hao (皓)

The case-back - a deep embossing of an animal of Chinese legend, Kunpeng

Ji - Chinese chic in Paris (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

Hao - Chinese chic in Paris (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

The case-back - high volume and detailed finishing (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

Atelier Wen was born from the collaboration of Chinese and French designers aiming to change perceptions in the watch industry. Indeed, though Chinese watchmaking is extremely developed and most watches today are made in China, few are willing to say it and even fewer to celebrate it.

At Atelier Wen, we have created watches that truly pay homage to Chinese watchmaking prowess. More than that, they are an attempt to bring you along a voyage of our vision of China; a China that is colourful, meaningful and full of poetry.

Ji's blue porcelain, resplendent on this quiet Beijing morning

Hao's pure white contrasts against the Forbidden City's vivid red

View of the case-back in front of Beijing's famous CCTV tower

The team behind Atelier Wen (from top left to bottom right: Robin Tallendier, Wilfried Buiron, Li Mingliang, Liu Yuguan)

Going over technical drawings

Well-deserved rest after a 16 hour train ride to visit our movement manufacturer in the north of China

Studying our case-back design with a manufacturer. Ours is very tricky to make, which means we could only work with the very best

Wilfried on a visit to our producers in Shenzhen... clearly in his element!

Our porcelain dials: Hao (皓) on the left, Ji (霁) on the right

"Ji" blue ceramic

Marine

Cloudy

Cobalt (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

Ji's rhodium-plated indexes bring structure and volume to its dial

Ji's subdial features a "Bagua" motif

"Qinghua Ci" (青花瓷) ceramic

Sleek and unassuming, yet subtly eye-catching

Hao overlooking Hong Kong's Wanchai district

A dial with a story (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

Hao's heat-blued hands, stunning under natural light

Hao's subdial features a stylised "Dizhi" (地支) cycle

The Peacock SL 3006 - a beautifully-made movement built for reliability (we get the date mechanism removed for our watches)

Liaoning Peacock Watch Company's offices in Dandong

Our visit to the LPWC in December 2017

Removing the movement's rotor reveals the detail of the workmanship inside

Japanese 316L steel, step case design, dual mirror-polish/brushed finish

The crown is carefully indented and engraved on the top with our logo

Each case-back is uniquely and individually numbered (p.c. Ron Good)

A quality travel pouch - blue top grain calf leather with suede lining

Three strap options: blue calf, grey nubuck and blue salmon

"乘风破浪" hot-stamping: "to ride the wind and break the waves"

Default strap: top grain blue calf leather, front and back

The first add-on is a grey nubuck strap with red top grain calf leather lining and minimal stitchings. This one gives the watches a more casual look, making them particularly versatile.

Send us a message if you'd like this one!​

Add-on strap 1: grey nubuck, red calf leather lining

The second add-on is a genuine blue salmon leather strap with orange top grain calf leather lining and full stitchings. This one is quite the head-turner! 

Send us a message if you'd like this one!​

Add-on strap 2: genuine blue salmon leather, orange calf leather lining

We ship worldwide for a fee of $15 ($8 for Hong Kong), which just about covers our costs. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

Attention : les montres qui suivent ne sont ni un énième hommage à la Submariner, ni la dernière édition de la série « luxe abordable » avec ses fameux garde-temps minimalistes…

Atelier Wen, " Porcelain Odyssey "

Ji (霁)

Hao (皓)

Le fond - une gravure profonde d'un animal de légende chinoise, Kunpeng

Ji - Le chic chinois au centre de Paris (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

Hao - Le chic chinois au centre de Paris (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

Le fond - relief profond et finitions détaillées (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

 

Atelier Wen est né de la collaboration entre des designers chinois et français ayant la vision commune de changer les perceptions vis-à-vis de l’industrie horlogère. En effet, bien que l’horlogerie chinoise soit très développée aujourd’hui, et que la majorité des montres soient, à vrai dire, faites en Chine, peu veulent l’admettre, et encore moins veulent le célébrer. 

Avec Atelier Wen, nous avons créé des montres rendant véritablement hommage au savoir-faire horloger chinois. Au-delà de ça, elles ont comme objectif de vous faire voyager à travers notre vision de la Chine ; une Chine pleine de couleurs, de sens, et de poésie.

Ji et sa porcelaine bleue, resplendissants dans cette matinée calme à Pékin

Le blanc pure de Hao contraste avec le rouge profond de la Cité Interdite

Vue du fond de la montre devant la célèbre tour CCTV de Pékin

Pour comprendre Atelier Wen et son univers, il est nécessaire de retourner aux sources et répondre à la question, « pourquoi un tel projet ? ».

L'équipe Atelier Wen (du gauche à droite et haut en bas: Robin Tallendier, Wilfried Buiron, Li Mingliang, Liu Yuguan)

Etudiant des dessins techniques

Repos bien mérité après 16 heures de train pour rendre visite à notre fournisseur de mouvements dans le nord de la Chine

Etudiant le fond de notre boîtier avec un fournisseur. Le notre étant particulièrement difficile à réaliser, nous ne pouvions travailler qu'avec les meilleurs

Wilfried en visite chez des fournisseurs à Shenzhen... clairement dans son élément!

Nos cadrans en porcelaine: Hao (皓) sur la gauche, Ji (霁) sur la droite

Céramique bleue de couleur "Ji"

Marin

Nuageux

Cobalt (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

Les indexes plaqués rhodium du modèle Ji apportent structure et volume au cadran

Le sous-cadran de Ji présente un motif "Bagua"

Céramique "Qinghua Ci" (青花瓷)

Soignée et sobre, mais subtilement créative

Hao avec le quartier de Wanchai à Hong Kong en arrière-plan

Un cadran riche en signification (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)

Les aiguilles bleuies à la flamme de Hao, rayonnantes sous la lumière du jour

Le sous cadran de Hao présente un cycle " Dizhi " stylisé

Le Peacock SL 3006 - un mouvement d'excellente fabrique construit pour la fiabilité (le mécanisme de date est démonté sur les nôtres)

Les bureaux de la Liaoning Peacock Watch Company à Dandong

Notre visite à la LPWC en décembre 2017

En retirant le rotor, on observe la qualité de la finition du mouvement

Acier 316L japonais, design " step-case ", finition alternée poli miroir/brossé

La couronne est soigneusement finie et gravée sur le dessus avec notre logo

Chaque fond est numéroté de manière unique et individuelle (p.c. Ron Good)

Trois option de bracelet: veau bleu, nubuck gris, saumon bleu

"乘风破浪" estampé à chaud: "chevaucher le vent et briser les vagues"

Bracelet par défaut: cuir de veau bleu " top grain " (côté interne et externe)

Le premier bracelet disponible en option est constitué d'un nubuck gris perle à l'extérieur de veau "top grain" de couleur rouge à l'intérieur, le tout avec des coutures minimalistes. Il confère aux montres une apparence plus détendue et décontractée, les rendant ainsi particulièrement versatiles.

Envoyez-nous en message si vous voulez ce bracelet!

Bracelet additionnel 1: nubuck gris perle, intérieur veau rouge

Le second bracelet disponible en option est constitué à l'extérieur de véritable cuir de saumon de couleur bleu cobalt et, à l'intérieur, de veau "top grain" de couleur orange, le tout avec des coutures complètes. Il accroche vraiment le regard!

Envoyez-nous en message si vous voulez ce bracelet!

Bracelet additionnel 2: véritable saumon bleu, intérieur veau orange

Nous expédions à travers le monde au prix fixe de $15 ($8 pour Hong Kong), ce qui couvre tout juste nos coûts. Veuillez noter que vous serez responsables du règlement de tous éventuels frais de douane et taxes en vigueur dans votre pays.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

As a team composed of Chinese watch experts, if there is one thing we are confident in is our ability to produce and deliver. Indeed, as production moves along, we will all personally be in China making sure things move along smoothly. In addition, we have very friendly relationships with almost all our manufacturers so we can guarantee that your watches will be looked after very carefully. 

That said, manufacturing can be unpredictable at times so if anything unexpected were to happen, we promise to keep you informed as soon as possible. In addition, we can always be reached at contact@atelierwen.com should you have any further questions.

 

RISQUES ET DEFIS

En tant qu’équipe composée d’experts en horlogerie chinoise, s’il y a bien une chose dans laquelle nous avons une confiance absolue, c’est notre capacité à produire et livrer des montres d’excellentes qualité. De plus, au fur et à mesure que la production avance, nous serons personnellement en Chine afin de nous assurer que tout se déroule sans encombre. Nous avons de très bonnes relations avec tous nos fournisseurs, nous permettant ainsi de vous garantir que vos montres recevront un soin tout particulier. 

Cela étant dit, produire en série peut parfois être imprédictible, donc si la situation était amenée à changer, nous vous promettons que vous en serez tenus informés dès que possible. Vous pouvez également toujours nous contacter via contact@atelierwen.com si vous avez la moindre question.
story_txt: Warning: the watches presented here are not an “homage” to the Submariner nor the latest specimen of Timepiece Minimalista from “affordable luxury” valley. Use caution! ;)Atelier Wen Porcelain OdysseyJi（霁）Hao (皓)The case-back - a deep embossing of an animal of Chinese legend, KunpengJi - Chinese chic in Paris (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)Hao - Chinese chic in Paris (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)The case-back - high volume and detailed finishing (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)Atelier Wen was born from the collaboration of Chinese and French designers aiming to change perceptions in the watch industry. Indeed, though Chinese watchmaking is extremely developed and most watches today are made in China, few are willing to say it and even fewer to celebrate it.At Atelier Wen, we have created watches that truly pay homage to Chinese watchmaking prowess. More than that, they are an attempt to bring you along a voyage of our vision of China; a China that is colourful, meaningful and full of poetry.Ji's blue porcelain, resplendent on this quiet Beijing morningHao's pure white contrasts against the Forbidden City's vivid redView of the case-back in front of Beijing's famous CCTV towerThe team behind Atelier Wen (from top left to bottom right: Robin Tallendier, Wilfried Buiron, Li Mingliang, Liu Yuguan)Going over technical drawingsWell-deserved rest after a 16 hour train ride to visit our movement manufacturer in the north of ChinaStudying our case-back design with a manufacturer. Ours is very tricky to make, which means we could only work with the very bestWilfried on a visit to our producers in Shenzhen... clearly in his element!Our porcelain dials: Hao (皓) on the left, Ji (霁) on the right"Ji" blue ceramicMarineCloudyCobalt (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)Ji's rhodium-plated indexes bring structure and volume to its dialJi's subdial features a "Bagua" motif"Qinghua Ci" (青花瓷) ceramicSleek and unassuming, yet subtly eye-catchingHao overlooking Hong Kong's Wanchai districtA dial with a story (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)Hao's heat-blued hands, stunning under natural lightHao's subdial features a stylised "Dizhi" (地支) cycleThe Peacock SL 3006 - a beautifully-made movement built for reliability (we get the date mechanism removed for our watches)Liaoning Peacock Watch Company's offices in DandongOur visit to the LPWC in December 2017Removing the movement's rotor reveals the detail of the workmanship insideJapanese 316L steel, step case design, dual mirror-polish/brushed finishThe crown is carefully indented and engraved on the top with our logoEach case-back is uniquely and individually numbered (p.c. Ron Good)A quality travel pouch - blue top grain calf leather with suede liningThree strap options: blue calf, grey nubuck and blue salmon"乘风破浪" hot-stamping: "to ride the wind and break the waves"Default strap: top grain blue calf leather, front and backThe first add-on is a grey nubuck strap with red top grain calf leather lining and minimal stitchings. This one gives the watches a more casual look, making them particularly versatile.Send us a message if you'd like this one!​Add-on strap 1: grey nubuck, red calf leather liningThe second add-on is a genuine blue salmon leather strap with orange top grain calf leather lining and full stitchings. This one is quite the head-turner! Send us a message if you'd like this one!​Add-on strap 2: genuine blue salmon leather, orange calf leather liningWe ship worldwide for a fee of $15 ($8 for Hong Kong), which just about covers our costs. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.Attention : les montres qui suivent ne sont ni un énième hommage à la Submariner, ni la dernière édition de la série « luxe abordable » avec ses fameux garde-temps minimalistes…Atelier Wen, " Porcelain Odyssey "Ji (霁)Hao (皓)Le fond - une gravure profonde d'un animal de légende chinoise, KunpengJi - Le chic chinois au centre de Paris (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)Hao - Le chic chinois au centre de Paris (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs)Le fond - relief profond et finitions détaillées (p.c. Les Rhabilleurs) Atelier Wen est né de la collaboration entre des designers chinois et français ayant la vision commune de changer les perceptions vis-à-vis de l’industrie horlogère. En effet, bien que l’horlogerie chinoise soit très développée aujourd’hui, et que la majorité des montres soient, à vrai dire, faites en Chine, peu veulent l’admettre, et encore moins veulent le célébrer. Avec Atelier Wen, nous avons créé des montres rendant véritablement hommage au savoir-faire horloger chinois. Au-delà de ça, elles ont comme objectif de vous faire voyager à travers notre vision de la Chine ; une Chine pleine de couleurs, de sens, et de poésie.Ji et sa porcelaine bleue, resplendissants dans cette matinée calme à PékinLe blanc pure de Hao contraste avec le rouge profond de la Cité InterditeVue du fond de la montre devant la célèbre tour CCTV de PékinPour comprendre Atelier Wen et son univers, il est nécessaire de retourner aux sources et répondre à la question, « pourquoi un tel projet ? ».L'équipe Atelier Wen (du gauche à droite et haut en bas: Robin Tallendier, Wilfried Buiron, Li Mingliang, Liu Yuguan)Etudiant des dessins techniquesRepos bien mérité après 16 heures de train pour rendre visite à notre fournisseur de mouvements dans le nord de la ChineEtudiant le fond de notre boîtier avec un fournisseur. Le notre étant particulièrement difficile à réaliser, nous ne pouvions travailler qu'avec les meilleursWilfried en visite chez des fournisseurs à Shenzhen... clairement dans son élément!Nos cadrans en porcelaine: Hao (皓) sur la gauche, Ji (霁) sur la droiteCéramique bleue de couleur "Ji"MarinNuageuxCobalt (p.c. story:
Short Summary

My Etsy team, The Milliners of Etsy, is a large part of my life. It's a group of over 375 milliners from all over the world. We've managed to build a strong community where milliners are committed to sharing everything that they know with each other so that we can help to make the art of hat making flourish. They are also friends, and we have shared some of our deepest sorrows and joys with each other.

On June 9, at the Acorn Theater in Three Oaks Michigan, we will have the first physical gathering of members. We are producing a fashion show featuring the lines of almost twenty members from around the United States. Members from as far as the UK, Australia and Israel who can't make it to the event are sending a single hat to a show that will have some of the finest millinery the world has to offer.

This event will put up and coming milliners like Amanda Joyner of Chef Bizzaro on equal footing with established professionals like Karen Morris and Jenny Pfanensteil of Formé Millinery. In this way, we will be truly sharing our art and audience with each other and with potentially thousands of others, as the event gets shared with the friends and followers of the rest of the group. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1000 to help with printing costs. While ticket sales themselves can help costs that occur at the event, printing must be paid before. We must be able to supply the theater with posters, to print formal invitations for the VIPs, and to send postcards to every possible audience member. Each member that is showing their collection will receive an ample supply for their own mailing lists. 

Besides, they're really beautiful. 

Go and see them in their full glory at our website: http://www.themillinersofetsy.com/posters-for-sale/

While you're there, look at the amazing work from Boring Sidney and Chef Bizarro, both of whom have given hours and weeks of her life to this event. Look at Rana's beautiful hats. She's sending us one from Tel Aviv. And Jenny Pfanensteil, who's had her work on First Lady Michele Obama's head. And Dianne Graham in Nashville. And Maggie Mowbray who's sending us a treasure from Scotland. And Aoife Kirwan sending magic from Ireland. I have stories about each of them.

We received a Fellowship Grant from Etsy to help us pay for a graphic designer. They helped us find Danielle Mitchell (http://www.daniellemitchell.com) who has created promotional pieces for us that are simply art in themselves. 

We intend to use the posters as our primary perks. They're gorgeous and every member of the team can use them as visual reminders of just how much they've helped this team to grow. Every friend, family member and customer can use them to be reminded of the gratitude we hold to those who help us. 

And besides, they're really beautiful. 

Every dollar contributed helps us to get us more press, audience and notice of people that can change our lives, and the lives of the greater membership. 

The Chicago Ballet (http://chicagoballetcenter.org), a 501c3 nonprofit, has graciously allowed us to use them as a fiscal agent. This means that contributions to the event are also tax-deductible. 

The Impact

The Hat and The Little Black Dress will bring regional, national and international notice to participating milliners and to the group as a whole. As we move onward from this event, we will be able to use invaluable contacts to help members in other parts of the world produce their own events. 

We will also be sending post-show press packets to major fashion magazines, giving all of the hat-makers in our organization opportunities they have only dreamed of.  

I am captain of this group of amazing people, an honor that I take very seriously. I made it to this place because of my background in arts management. I have successfully produced performances for theater, music and dance. Our models are, in fact, ballet dancers from The Chicago Ballet, a company that I used to work with. I can do this with the help of my team. And my team is the greatest, so I'm pretty sure that we can do this in an amazing way. 

I encourage people who do not know it to look at the Acorn website (http://www.acorntheater.com) to see just why we have chosen this extraordinary venue. 

Other Ways You Can Help

As artists, we are often living on the edge. We Milliners of Etsy live on that edge often. Helping to spread the word about this campaign and about the event in particular helps too. Help make this viral.

story:
We are on a mission to make fashion circular 

... and we need your help! 

                                                                    

Why do we need a circular economy for fashion and textiles? 

Today, less than 1% of clothing is recycled into new clothing. The way the fashion industry operates is largely aligned to a linear way of production and consumption. It relies on large quantities of resources to quickly be manufactured into clothing, consumed and disposed shortly after. The consequences of relying upon a linear approach on a planet with finite resources are not hard to imagine and result in resource degradation, water and air pollution, loss of biodiversity and increasing amounts of waste - to name a few. 

 

How do we get there? 

To protect our planet, we need to shift to a more thoughtful model in which materials and resources are re-used and recycled. To design for circularity, responsible, clever and creative decisions need to be taken in every aspect of a garment’s life - from choosing the right materials, design and construction, retail and use, to finally ensure reuse and recycling.

Born out of the mission to reduce fashion’s environmental impact, circular.fashion has developed a digital platform that enables garments to be designed for circularity from the very beginning.

 

 

The circular.fashion system

- enabling garments of today to become the resources of tomorrow 

The circular.fashion system is a one-stop solution for circular design and closed loop recycling. The circular design software, including a material library and design guidelines, makes designing for circularity easy. The material library showcases sustainable fabrics, yarns and trims which have been tested for future recyclability. The design guidelines offers state-of-the-art strategies, solutions and product briefings on how to design for circularity. A product check will make sure that the selected combination of materials and design strategy is approved for recyclability at end of life. 

 

 

All approved products retrieve a unique circularity.ID, a digital information carrier, holding full transparency of the piece -  from materials and production to options for updating, reusing and recycling. The circularity.ID orchestrates a network of reverse supply chain intelligence. It is scannable by customers opening up an interface that provides visibility and ongoing communication after point of sale. A sorting software enables efficient product identification and ensures that each piece is delivered to its predefined fibre-to-fibre recycler.  

 

In summary, the circular.fashion system cultivates a much-needed circular center for the innovative ideas of today and the conscious customers of tomorrow. Together we can realise a circular economy for fashion and textiles. 

 

Join our Pilot Study

 

Join us on a pioneering pilot study of the circular.fashion system and help us take crucial steps towards a circular future of fashion. We have a limited run of 100 t-shirts tagged with our unique circularity.ID and we need your help to get them circulating! 

We want to learn from you how a circular product is used, reused and disposed of. The circularity.ID opens up this dialogue and holds the full story of the garment from insights on material and production, to instructions on how to prolong the use of the piece, to finally ensure recycling. 

Get your circular t-shirt today and be part of this groundbreaking study! 

 

 

Our team 

circular.fashion was founded by Ina Budde and Mario Malzacher in Berlin, 2017 on the
mission to make circular design easy and accessible for brands and designers and
increase the share of garments currently being recycled. The team now consists of eight
passionates with interdisciplinary backgrounds combined with many years of work
experience in lecturing on sustainable fashion design and circular business models,
design thinking, process management, textile engineering and software development.

Together, we share the vision of a circular future of fashion and it is our mission to find
and spread solutions that accelerates the transformation towards such a future.

 

 

What people say about us

 

 

„‚Best workshop ever!” – Melanie, Designer HUGO BOSS

 

„Very impressive how you drove theory into action. Efficient, respectful cooperation of all parties involved.” – Caroline, Graphics Team Lead Hugo Boss

 

„The Workshop with circular.fashion was a vital step for us. We really appreciated and enjoyed the interactive and hands-on approach and that the workshop was tailored for our business needs.“ – Vretena

 

„When designing the soft workwear uniform we as a team were faced with a challenge of finding a true circular design approach. circular.fashion with their design guidelines helped us develop a product that was actually focused on longevity and in the end gave us their product check which approved it for recyclability." – Hanna, Silfir 

 

„One of the best trainings I have attended so far.” – Julia Ohnmus, Buyer Womens zLabels

 

„circular.fashion offers a holistic approach around circularity so every brand can just go there and find everything they need to create a circular product in one place." – Salah, Corporate Citizen Manager, Zalando

 

„The plush jacket originated from a collaboration between MYRKA studios and circular.fashion. Their Circular Design Software is going to change the fashion industry. It makes the design process of combining sustainability and circularity so much easier.“  – Lia, Myrka Studios

story:
We know how annoying it can be swapping your things between bags, so we wanted to create bags that will take you from home to work, office to the airport, from a meeting to the weekend away. Bags you can take wherever you go, and charge up your tech on the way.

 

 

A power pack with multiple inputs to charge gadgets anytime, anywhere.

 

 

Charge your smartphone up to six times on the go.

Multi-input to charge multiple devices at once or even access the battery from outside the bag via the built-in USB port, if you’d like to keep using your device while it’s charging.

Once the battery itself runs out of charge, you can simply take it out of the bag and connect to a power point - just like you would charge most of your gadgets. It will be fully charged in 4 hours.

 

                                                       

                                                 

      RFID (Radio-frequency identification) is the use of radio waves to read, capture, and interact with information stored on a tag. Tags are usually attached to objects, and can be read from several feet away. This can create a security issue, so we’ve designed our pocket to block RFID and help you protect the personal information stored on your bank cards, passport and more.

 

 

  

 

 

Airport security checks become a breeze with a laptop pocket, securely hidden and easily accessible at the rear of the bag.

                                               

 

 

Our fabric is easy-clean and fast dry. 900D polyester with TPE lamination - similar to that used in tents and other outdoor equipment.

 

Reflective features help to ensure your safety when using your bag at night.

               

Comfortable enough to carry around your essentials every day, including the airport

Straps which are specially designed and ergonomic to support posture and comfort

Adjustable shoulder straps and a built-in hand strap

 

 

 

We founded Redland in London in 2004,to create a brand that captured the anticipation and excitement of travel. Since then, we’ve launched multiple bag collections and worked with some awesome partners like Pantone, V&A, Oasis and Julien McDonald.

Throughout our journey we’ve stayed committed to finding the perfect blend of materials and craft, resulting in products that adapt to the ever-changing needs of modern people on the go.

It’s been a pleasure and an honour to work with household names like the V&A and Pantone, but this time, we wanted to do something different. We wanted to create a collection 100% Redland.

We took everything we’ve learned from our previous collections and combined it with what really matters to us - quality and style at a price point that is attainable. We’ve since travelled to the Far East to source fabric, co-ordinated with battery manufacturers and worked through numerous prototypes to get to where we are now.

This brings us to Indiegogo. The reason we need you. Your support will help us proceed with manufacturing and create your favourite everyday bag. Your feedback and support are invaluable to us and we appreciate every single question, comment and pledge.

                                       

In 2017, our work with Pantone was nominated for a German Design Award. Our founders were also finalists for the Duke of York, New Entrepreneur of the Year (2017) for the Lloyds Bank National Business Awards

In our experience we understand that shipping costs can be a real barrier to people making a purchase. With that in mind we have teamed up with three logistics partners around the world, based in the US, Europe, and Asia. Through these centres we are in a position to offer free worldwide shipping. So the price you see will be the final price you pay. 

We are conscious that in other campaigns customers have been charged duty and sales tax in addition to their cost of purchase.  We have noticed that some people are taken by surprise on receipt of these additional charges. We have spent time to ensure that our logistics are in place to minimise all charges. We can commit that any products purchased by customers within the EU and the USA will not be liable for any additional charges. No Shipping, customs, or duties will be payable. The price you see is the total price you will be paying. 

 

A quick aside from the campaign: This year the company will donate 1% of our gross revenue, (not just profit) to a group of certified charities involved with helping refugees around the world. This is separate from our Indiegogo project, whether or not we get enough backers. We will share our fundraising achievement with our backer community. 

We take great care to ensure that the factories we work with adhere to the highest standards. In addition to our factories being audited annually, through our years of experience we have visited on numerous occasions and know the mangers and owners of the factories. We work with them because they go beyond the basic requirements. They take pride to ensure that from working conditions, entitlements, job security through to career development. Employees are taken care of.

We believe in our products and ensuring our partners are happy with their purchase. We provide a 15 year guarantee with all of our products. This is not an airy fairy promise - if there is an manufacturing quality fault with your bag, we will replace your product.  

Our process are straightforward, any issues which may arise will be dealt with quickly. 

We have seen with great frustration the number of campaigns involved with our industry that end up not delivering on their products and projects. we know and love what we're doing, and you can be confident we will deliver.

Thank you for your support.

We have designed and manufactured backpacks and travel items for a long time. Through our years of experience and knowledge of how to manufacture high quality products, we are well positioned to deliver on this project.

In fact we are so confident you’ll love the our bags that we guarantee it! When you receive your bag(s), if you’re not 100% satisfied simply send it back for a full refund of the purchase price (shipping and handling fees are non-refundable). We’re pretty confident you’ll be more excited to wear your bag (s) than return it though!

When we have encountered issues in the past, we have always dealt with them in a way that leaves our customers happy with their purchase and proud to be joining our journey.

Supply Chain Risk: We have been working with our supply chain over a number of years and have complete faith that we can deliver when we say we will. Delays can occur and we have allowed in our schedule some buffer for those unexpected hold-ups. If unexpected issues arise, we will handle them with transparency, care, and respect for our backers.

It will be fully charged in 4 hours.                                                                                                               RFID (Radio-frequency identification) is the use of radio waves to read, capture, and interact with information stored on a tag. story:
Short Summary

My name is Jenny Lee Maas owner of JLMaas.  I come from a mixed media background of fine art and design, which I bring into my fashion designs.

I am hoping to raise money to help me not only get to NYC fashion week but also bring the best possible collection I can make.  With funds raised, I could hire an assistant on my more ambitious garments.

This opportunity is important to me because it will give my design a whole new platform to be seen and has the potential to lead to many other opportunities. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • My goal is to raise $4000.00.  This money would go to the production of the work itself (fabric, assistants) and show costs (fees, travel)
  • If I don't reach my goal I will work with whatever I receive.  Any help is a blessing :)
  • Perks!

The Impact

  • This opportunity will allow my work to be seen by an international audience, opening more doors for opportunity and success.
  • I recently had my first fashion show at Atlantic City Fashion week, it was successful but everything was done myself.  I would love to be able to hire an assistant to help with complicated dresses and have more funds to obtain high end fabrics.

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges are to create the best garments I have ever made.  To use them as a launch pad for my brand, my business and my future.  Having some funds to work with would give me the boost I need for:

  • Fabrics
  • Assistants
  • Other miscellaneous materials (threads, beads etc.)

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign!  I have 3 months to get as much support as possible.
  • You can share it using the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much :)
